model

Class DeBruijnWordChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.DeBruijnWordChecker

  • public class DeBruijnWordChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to verify De Bruijn words and universal partial words

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DeBruijnWordChecker() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static DeBruijnWordCheckerResults checkDeBruijnWord(java.lang.String DeBruijnWord, int n)
      Checks if the given word is a valid De Bruijn word First Generates a list of codes which should appear in the word Then calculates each code that appears in the word and updates list of missing and duplicate codes Then returns a DeBruijnWordCheckerResults which holds a list of any missing and duplicate codes
      private static void checkUniversalCharacter(java.lang.String code, int n, char universalCharacter, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> alphabet, java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> remainingCodes, java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> duplicateCodes)
      Takes a code and marks it as covered or duplicate appropriately If the code contains a universal character, calls this method recursively with the universal character replaced by each letter in the alphabet
      static DeBruijnWordCheckerResults checkUniversalPartialWord(java.lang.String DeBruijnWord, int n, char universalCharacter)
      Checks if the given word is a valid universal partial word taking into account the given universal character First Generates a list of codes which should appear in the word Then calculates each code that appears in the word passes it to checkUniversalCharacter along with list of missing and duplicate codes Finally returns a DeBruijnWordCheckerResults which holds a list of any missing and duplicate codes
      private static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> generateAllCodes(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> alphabet, int n)
      Generates a HashSet of all unique codes of length n that exist using the given alphabet
      private static void generateAllCodes(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> alphabet, java.lang.String code, int k, int n, java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> codes)
      Adds each letter in the alphabet to the current code and call recursively Repeat this extension until codes length is n
      private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> generateAlphabet(java.lang.String word)
      Extracts alphabet from all existing characters in given word

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeBruijnWordChecker

        public DeBruijnWordChecker()

    • Method Detail

      • checkDeBruijnWord

        public static DeBruijnWordCheckerResults checkDeBruijnWord(java.lang.String DeBruijnWord,
                                                           int n)
        Checks if the given word is a valid De Bruijn word First Generates a list of codes which should appear in the word Then calculates each code that appears in the word and updates list of missing and duplicate codes Then returns a DeBruijnWordCheckerResults which holds a list of any missing and duplicate codes
        Parameters:
        DeBruijnWord - The word to be checked
        n - The code length
        Returns:
        DeBruijnWordCheckerResults containing a list of all codes that are missing from the word and any duplicates

      • checkUniversalPartialWord

        public static DeBruijnWordCheckerResults checkUniversalPartialWord(java.lang.String DeBruijnWord,
                                                                   int n,
                                                                   char universalCharacter)
        Checks if the given word is a valid universal partial word taking into account the given universal character First Generates a list of codes which should appear in the word Then calculates each code that appears in the word passes it to checkUniversalCharacter along with list of missing and duplicate codes Finally returns a DeBruijnWordCheckerResults which holds a list of any missing and duplicate codes
        Parameters:
        DeBruijnWord -
        n - The code length
        universalCharacter -
        Returns:

      • checkUniversalCharacter

        private static void checkUniversalCharacter(java.lang.String code,
                                            int n,
                                            char universalCharacter,
                                            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> alphabet,
                                            java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> remainingCodes,
                                            java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> duplicateCodes)
        Takes a code and marks it as covered or duplicate appropriately If the code contains a universal character, calls this method recursively with the universal character replaced by each letter in the alphabet
        Parameters:
        code - The current code being considered
        n - The code length
        universalCharacter -
        alphabet - The alphabet of this word and universal character
        remainingCodes - List of codes not yet covered in word
        duplicateCodes - List of duplicate codes in word

      • generateAllCodes

        private static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> generateAllCodes(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> alphabet,
                                                                    int n)
        Generates a HashSet of all unique codes of length n that exist using the given alphabet
        Parameters:
        alphabet -
        n - The code length
        Returns:
        The codes generated

      • generateAllCodes

        private static void generateAllCodes(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> alphabet,
                                     java.lang.String code,
                                     int k,
                                     int n,
                                     java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> codes)
        Adds each letter in the alphabet to the current code and call recursively Repeat this extension until codes length is n
        Parameters:
        alphabet -
        code - The current code so far
        k - The alphabet size
        n - Initially the code length, used as depth in recursive calls
        codes -

      • generateAlphabet

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> generateAlphabet(java.lang.String word)
        Extracts alphabet from all existing characters in given word
        Parameters:
        word -
        Returns:
        List of characters that appear in word
